Comment: What annoys me the most about the GOP is that Trump is enacting the largest tax increase on the country EVER, and you don’t hear any push back from these mealy mouthed cowards.  Trump is effectively putting a national sales tax increase place, and a whopper of one. But they all go mum at his very thinly veiled claim he has to do it using a national security act.  He has no business enacting  unilateral tax increases!  But the cowards in Congress will do nothing to stop this.  These fucks need to pay a heavy price at the ballot box come every election going forward.  I’m no fan of the geriatric, do nothing Dems, but I’d rather have demented Joe in office than this shit show any day of the week. And before all you fired Dem staffers pile on with everything Joe did, eat this: the main thing Joe didn’t do was put the right AG in place, someone who would have swiftly given us justice for January 6th, and possibly avoided Trump returning to power. But no, in good Dem tradition, it was Garland’s turn, let it be damned he was the worst choice for the times. The Dems are just as cowardly as the GOP.  Let the down voting begin, because the only messages that are promoted on here are the one line choruses of “slams” that create this ridiculous echo chamber on reddit.

Comment: Traditional conservative republicans have largely been displaced by Christian nationalists, making the republicans the party of “Tear it all down and rebuild it as God intended.”  Expect an onslaught of attacks on the separation of church and state to go along with their dismantling of our democracy.  Washington Spectator - [How the CNP, a Republican Powerhouse, Helped Spawn Trumpism, Disrupted the Transfer of Power, and Stoked the Assault on the Capitol](https://washingtonspectator.org/nelson-cnp/)  “Operating from the shadows, [the Council for National Policy’s] members, who would number some 400, spent the next four decades courting, buying, and bullying fellow Republicans, gradually achieving what was in effect a leveraged buyout of the GOP.”  HuffPost - [How Dominionists Gained Control Of The Trump Campaign](https://www.huffpost.com/entry/dominionists-gain-control-of-trump-campaign_b_57c817d0e4b06c750dd8d25a)  “Dominionists believe that America is a Christian nation and they oppose the separation of church and state. Ted Cruz’s father is a Dominionist preacher. They mix well with Christian Reconstructionists who want to impose strict biblical laws on America including execution for adultery, blasphemy, and homosexuality. These two fringe religious groups make up the majority of the [Council for National Policy’s] 500 member base; along with a colorful array of extreme activists on the far right. The Council’s goal is to manipulate government agenda from within.”
